question: Which missile system did DRDO successfully test in February 2024 to counter aerial threats at very short ranges?
explanation: DRDO conducted two successful flight tests of the Very Short-Range Air Defence System (VSHORADS) in February 2024, designed to intercept and destroy hostile aircraft, drones, and helicopters at very short ranges.

question: What is the primary purpose of India's Project Kusha?

options.A: Developing a long-range air defence system

explanation: Project Kusha aims to develop a mobile long-range surface-to-air missile system, consisting of three variants (M1, M2, M3) with ranges of 150 km, 250 km, and 400 km, respectively.

question: Which missile system did India successfully test at an altitude of over 15,000 feet in Ladakh in July 2025?
explanation: The Indian Army successfully tested the Akash Prime air defence missile system in Ladakh at an altitude exceeding 15,000 feet on July 16, 2025, demonstrating its effectiveness in high-altitude environments.

question: Which missile system did DRDO successfully test on July 24, 2024, as part of Phase-II Ballistic Missile Defence?
explanation: DRDO successfully flight-tested the Phase-II Ballistic Missile Defence System on July 24, 2024, involving a target missile launched from Launch Complex IV at Dhamra, which was detected and intercepted by the AD Interceptor system.

question: What is the range of the M1 variant of DRDO's Project Kusha missile system?
explanation: The M1 variant of DRDO's Project Kusha missile system has a range of 150 km and is expected to undergo testing in early 2025.

question: Which missile system did DRDO successfully test on October 3 and 4, 2024, at Pokhran Field Firing Ranges?
explanation: DRDO successfully conducted three flight tests of the 4th Generation Very Short Range Air Defence System (VSHORADS) at Pokhran Field Firing Ranges on October 3 and 4, 2024, demonstrating critical parameters of maximum range and altitude interception.

question: Which missile system did DRDO successfully test on March 26, 2025, off the Odisha coast?
explanation: DRDO successfully flight-tested the Vertically-Launched Short-Range Surface-to-Air Missile (VLSRSAM) on March 26, 2025, off the Odisha coast, enhancing the Indian Navy's air defence capabilities.

question: Which missile system did DRDO successfully test on November 16, 2024, off the Odisha coast?
explanation: DRDO conducted a successful flight trial of India's first long-range hypersonic missile on November 16, 2024, off the Odisha coast, capable of carrying various payloads for ranges greater than 1,500 km.

question: Which missile system did DRDO successfully test on July 28 and 29, 2025, from Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Island?
explanation: DRDO successfully conducted two consecutive flight tests of the Pralay missile on July 28 and 29, 2025, from Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Island off the coast of Odisha, demonstrating high precision and radar-evading capabilities.

explanation: DRDO successfully flight-tested the Vertically-Launched Short-Range Surface-to-Air Missile (VLSRSAM) on March 26, 2025, off the Odisha coast, enhancing the Indian Navy's air defence capabilities.
